trans-unit.source: Provides pixel format conversion functionality for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.
Property changes can occur only during object initialization.

Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> objects created using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Media.PixelFormat%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette%2CSystem.Double%29> constructor are automatically initialized, and property changes are ignored.
For format conversions between RGB color spaces with different characteristics, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap> class should be used.
Conversions between color spaces need a source color profile and destination color profile for gamut mapping to provide a reliable color conversion.

The color profiles are provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.ColorContext> parameters of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap.%23ctor%2A> or by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap.DestinationColorContext%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap.SourceColorContext%2A> properties.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.

To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> class that has the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.Source"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationFormat"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationPalette"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.AlphaThreshold"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.Source"></xref> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationFormat"></xref> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> instance.
The of the new instance if destinationFormat is an indexed format.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.AlphaThreshold"></xref> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> instance.
Gets or sets the alpha channel threshold of a bitmap when converting to palletized formats that recognizes an alpha color.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.AlphaThreshold%2A> value is used to determine what level of opacity will be mapped to the fully transparent color in the converted format.
A value of 9.8 implies that any pixel with an alpha value of less than 25 will be mapped to the transparent color.
A value of 100 maps all pixels which are not fully opaque to the transparent color.
The destination palette should provide a transparent color; otherwise, the transparent color will be the one closest to zero, often black.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The alpha channel threshold for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref>.
The default value is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.AlphaThreshold"></xref> dependency property.
Signals the start of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.
After the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> is currently being initialized.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit"></xref> has already been called.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> has already been initialized.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets the pixel format to convert the bitmap to.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The pixel format to apply to the bitmap.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PixelFormats.Pbgra32"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationFormat"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the palette to apply to the bitmap if the format is indexed.
You must set this property if you want to use an indexed pixel format for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationFormat%2A>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The destination palette to apply to the bitmap.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationPalette"></xref> dependency property.
Signals the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap"></xref> initialization.

Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls, as demonstrated in the following example.
After the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.Source"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationFormat"></xref> property is an indexed format and the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.DestinationPalette"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-
The palette colors do not match the destination format.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.EndInit"></xref> method is called without first calling <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.BeginInit"></xref>.
Gets or sets the source for the bitmap.

You can chain a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> to another <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.Source%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> that you want.
See [How to: Chain BitmapSource Objects Together](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-chain-bitmapsource-objects-together.md) for an example of chaining.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The source for the bitmap.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.FormatConvertedBitmap.Source"></xref> dependency property.
